result.execSummary:
The defendant Kory L. Deacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Corrected to include Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse *

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $109.82, from 16CM46, Read In  -* Joint and several*

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kory L. Deacy

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Kory L. Deacy in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF146, 15CF171, 15CF242, 16CF13 & 16CM46 @ 3:22 p.m. 16CM46 - copy of complaint received, reading waived, will be dismissed and read in as part of total agreement. $109.82 restitution joint & several to be read in. Written summary of agreement filed. Def has reviewed with atty and wishes to proceed. Plea quest. reviewed. 15CF146 - ct 1 will be dismissed, no prelim waiver needed. Plea to ct 2 - guilty. Plea to ct 3 - no contest. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 1. 15CF171 - Plea to ct 2 - guilty. Plea to ct 3 - guilty. Plea to ct 4 - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss ct 1 without prejudice. 15CF242 Plea to ct 1 - guilty. Plea to ct 4 - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 2, 3 & 5. 16CF13 Plea to ct 1 - guilty. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in cts 2 & 3. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 16CM46. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Bayne-Allison satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF146 ct 2 and ct 3, 15CF171 cts 2, 3, and 4, 15CF242 cts 1 and 4, 16CF13 ct 1. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. State has complied with VWNR. Off the record 3:52. Back on the record 3:54. Discussion off the record regarding credit for time served. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. 15CF146 on cts 2 & 3  - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, restitution - State has 60 days to determine, reserve right to rest. hrg. Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Credit for 2 days served if revoked. 15CF171 cts 2, 3, & 4 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation on each, restitutiton $49.94, Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, 30 days jail on each ct, concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other ordered. Credit for 1 day served if revoked. 15CF242 ct 1 & 4 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation on each, concurrent, restitution $612.70, court costs, DNA surcharges, counseling as required, 45 days jail on each ct, concurrent to each other but consecutive to 15CF171. 16CF13 ct 1 - 6 yrs prison, imposed & stayed, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv., 2 yrs probation, concurrent. Court explains reason for sentence. Conditions of probation, restitution $9.94, court costs, DNA surcharge, 60 days jail, consecutive to 15CF171 and 15CF242. 16CM46 - $109.82 restitution, joint & several.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Huber as allowed by jail. Sentence starts today. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF242, 16CF13, 15CF171 and 15CF146 @ 10:36 a.m. 15CF146 - State will not file information today. Prelim hrgs will be waived in other 3 cases and all set for plea/sentencing. 15CF242 and 16CF13 - copies of complaints received and Atty Bayne-Allison has reviewed with Def. Def waives prelim hrgs, in 15CF242, 16CF13 and 15CF171. Court reviews waivers with Defendant. Court accepts waivers as knowing & voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over each. Informations filed. Copies received, reading waived, 15CF171 not guilty pleas, Court accepts and directs entry. 15CF242 - Copy received, reading waived, not guilty pleas to each ct. Court accepts pleas and directs entry. 16CF13 - copy of information received, reading waived, not guilty pleas to all cts. Court receives and directs entry of pleas.  15CF146 - State asks Def to clarify that time limits continue to be waived. Atty Bayne-Allison agrees. Def agrees. Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CF13 & 15CF242.  Def has atty on another case.  Statement by Court.  Def instructed to call the public defenders office  Bonds will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kory L. Deacy in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CF13 and 15CF242.  Def has copy of complaints.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties.  Def has an atty appointed on another case.  Def instructed to contact public defenders office.  15CF242 State request signature bond .  Court sets signature bond with condition  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
